data.title: The GNU Image Manipulation program
data.text:
Gimp -- The GNU Image Manipulation program

Mon 29 January 2018 by Franz Kirsten

The slides are in this gimp.pdf

Also check out the notes on inkscape

What is it?

Wikipedia

(GNU Image Manipulation Program) is a free and open-source raster graphics editor used for image retouching and editing, free-form drawing, converting between different image formats, and more specialized tasks.

Gimp - what I use it for

Enhance quality of and/or modify plots taken from papers for talks

Create schematics (i.e. free drawing)

scale/retouch images and photos

Get it, docs, manuals

linux distributions like Ubuntu ship it as a package (get it via apt-get)

check out the gimp website for documentation
